description: enough information about each assignment to create an overview and generate code-review/report links

name.description: what the assignment is called.  this name will by default be used as the repo name for generating links, unless a repo name is specifically defined (see the 'repo' field below)

live.description: defaults to false. whether or not to expect a live site accompanying this assignment. if the value is true, a link to github pages will be auto-generated.  if the value is a string that string will be treated as the url for the live project.  Strings will have all instances of '<user-name>' replaced with the student's github user name, '<class-name>' will be replaced with the class repo's name

source.description: optional, defaults to true. if string, a URL where to find the source code. if true, a github link will be generated from the repo/name and student.userName. if false, no source link will be generated.  Strings will have all instances of '<user-name>' replaced with the student's github user name, '<class-name>' will be replaced with the class repo's name

endpoints.description: a list of sub-folders/files to be completed. there will be no api check, if the repo exists buttons to the source code will be rendered. if the repo is live, live links will also be rendered

items.description: relative paths to the directory/file expected

branches.description: (master is implied, and always used for main links). any assigned branches. can be used for tutorials, features, development workflows, ... any reason you might assign branches. Does not assume branches will have the same directory structure as main project on master.  eventually might be worth assigning endpoints on branches, but reports won't be possible

items.description: used to render links to this branch

reports.description: a list of any and all report files a student is expected to build and push for this assignment.  reports will be pulled from github pages as an API and logged to the console directly in the live app

items.description: relative paths to report files from the top of the repo. should indicate file & extension
